title: Belgian spacetech gem VEOWARE secures €2,5 million euro to empower spacecrafts with next-generation agility
summary: Brussels, Sept. 19, 2024. VEOWARE, a pioneer in enhancing satellite motion control, has raised €2.5 million in a funding round by imec.istart future fund, Ostbelgieninvest – OBI, Moveinvest (Noshaq & […]

title: The Marshall Star for September 18, 2024
summary: Marshall Welcomes NASA Chief Scientist for Climate, Science Town Hall NASA Chief Scientist and Senior Climate Advisor Kate Calvin, center left, joins team members at the agency’s Marshall Space Flight Center for a Climate and Science Town Hall on Sept. 17 in Activities Building 4316. Calvin took part in a question-and-answer session during her visit […]

title: Boeing to demonstrate air-space sensor fusion for U.S. military operations
summary: Kay Sears: ‘We're going to connect the E-7 to the Foo Fighter network and the MEO missile warning and tracking layer’

title: LEO takes center stage for communications at sea
summary: Ship owners are increasingly relegating geostationary satellites to the backseat and turning to low Earth orbit networks for primary communications at sea, according to a panel of multi-orbit maritime service providers.

title: Rocket Lab’s Electron rocket experiences abort as its Rutherford engines began firing, prior to liftoff
summary: When it launches, the mission will be the 53rd launch of an Electron rocket to date. It was scrubbed as the nine Rutherford engines were firing, but prior to liftoff.

title: NASA Deputy Administrator Talks Future of Agency in Silicon Valley
summary: NASA Deputy Administrator Pam Melroy spent time at NASA’s Ames Research Center in California’s Silicon Valley, on Sept. 16, 2024, engaging with center leaders and employees to discuss strategies that could drive meaningful changes to ensure NASA remains the preeminent institution for research, technology, and engineering, and to lead science, aeronautics, and space exploration for […]

title: NASA Shares Hidden Figures Congressional Gold Medal Remarks
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson released his remarks as prepared for Wednesday’s Hidden Figures Congressional Gold Medal ceremony in Washington. The awards recognized the women who contributed to the space race, including the NASA mathematicians who helped land the first astronauts on the Moon under the agency’s Apollo Program. “Good afternoon. “The remarkable things that NASA […]

title: Giant Leaps Start at Johnson for NASA’s SpaceX Crew-9 Commander Nick Hague
summary: As the hub of human spaceflight, NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston holds a variety of unique responsibilities and privileges. Those include being the home of NASA’s astronaut corps. One of those astronauts – Nick Hague – is now preparing to launch to the International Space Station along with Roscosmos cosmonaut Aleksandr Gorbunov on the […]

title: FCC Commissioner calls out agency for hypocritical take on SpaceX Starlink
summary: FCC Commissioner Brendan Carr is calling out the agency for a hypocritical take on SpaceX’s Starlink. Last week, we reported on FCC...

title: United Launch Alliance prepares for crucial certification flight as U.S. Space Force watches closely
summary: Brig. Gen. Panzenhagen: Following Vulcan’ Cert-2 mission, “We will need some time to make sure that everything was clean”
